rain: Water that falls from the sky.
pot: A container used for cooking or storing food.
tree: A large plant with a trunk, branches, and leaves.
computer: An electronic device that processes data.
apple: A round fruit with red, yellow, or green skin and a crisp, sweet interior.
book: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together.
sun: The star at the center of our solar system that provides light and heat.
moon: The natural satellite of the Earth, visible at night by reflected light from the sun.
ocean: A vast body of saltwater that covers almost three quarters of the Earth's surface.
mountain: A large natural elevation of the Earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level.
river: A large, flowing body of water that usually empties into a sea or ocean.
flower: The colorful part of a plant that attracts pollinators.
bird: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate characterized by feathers and wings.
car: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine.
bicycle: A vehicle composed of two wheels held in a frame one behind the other, propelled by pedals.
phone: A device that converts sound into electrical signals for communication.
keyboard: A panel of keys that operate a computer or typewriter.
chair: A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
table: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, used for placing things on.
window: An opening in the wall or roof of a building, fitted with glass.
door: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle.
lamp: A device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something.
clock: A device for measuring and indicating time.
notebook: A small book with blank or ruled pages for writing notes.
pizza: A dish made typically of flattened bread dough topped with tomatoes, cheese, and various other ingredients.
coffee: A brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans.
tea: A hot drink made by infusing the dried crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.
milk: A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals, used as food by humans.
bread: A staple food made from flour and water, usually by baking.
butter: A dairy product made from churning cream.
cheese: A dairy product derived from milk that is produced in a wide range of flavors and textures.
egg: An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo.
salt: A white crystalline substance used to season food and preserve it.
sugar: A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet.
milkshake: A sweet drink made by blending milk, ice cream, and flavorings.
sandwich: An item of food consisting of two pieces of bread with filling between them.
cake: An item of soft sweet food made from a mixture of flour, shortening, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients.
ice cream: A sweetened frozen food typically eaten as a snack or dessert.
juice: A drink made from the extraction or pressing of the natural liquid contained in fruit and vegetables.
water: A clear, colorless, odorless, and tasteless liquid essential for most plant and animal life.
butterfly: A nectar-feeding insect with large, often brightly colored wings.
fish: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
lion: A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides, found in Africa and northwestern India.
elephant: A large herbivorous mammal noted for its long trunk and tusks, native to Africa and southern Asia.
guitar: A stringed musical instrument with a fretted fingerboard, typically played with the fingers or a pick.
piano: A large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case enclosing a soundboard and metal strings.
painting: A picture or design executed with paint.
movie: A story or event recorded by a camera as a set of moving images and shown in a theater or on television.
music: Vocal or instrumental sounds combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.
game: A form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules.
language: A system of communication used by a particular country or community.
friend: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
family: A group consisting of parents and their children, living together as a unit.
love: An intense feeling of deep affection.
sadness: The condition or quality of being sad.
anger: A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
fear: An unpleasant emotion caused by the threat of danger, pain, or harm.
